subject: Technology
title: The Rise of Nokia
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Rise of Nokia.

hook.text: In the late 1990s, Nokia sold nearly half of all mobile phones on Earth. They seemed unstoppable.

buildup.text: Nokia started as a paper mill in Finland. It pivoted to rubber, then cables, then electronics.

discovery.text: The Nokia 3310 became legendary for its durability. Drop it and the floor would crack, not the phone.

twist.text: Nokia dismissed touchscreens and app stores. By 2013, they sold their phone division to Microsoft.

climax.text: The company that defined mobile phones missed the smartphone era completely.

punchline.text: Nokia made the best phones. Then the rules changed overnight.

quiz.question: Why did Nokia decline?
options: They dismissed touchscreens and app stores
